affinity.description: DEPRECATED: Use main, worker, and webhook blocks affinity fields instead. This field will be removed in a future release.
affinity.title: affinity

enabled.description: Whether to enable the Public API
enabled.title: enabled

path.description: Path segment for the Public API
path.title: path

swagger.description: Whether to enable the Swagger UI for the Public API
swagger.title: swagger

availableModes.description: Available modes of binary data storage. If not set, the default mode will be used. For more information, see https://docs.n8n.io/hosting/configuration/environment-variables/binary-data/
availableModes.title: availableModes

mode.description: The default binary data mode. default keeps binary data in memory. Set to filesystem to use the filesystem, or s3 to AWS S3. Note that binary data pruning operates on the active binary data mode. For example, if your instance stored data in S3, and you later switched to filesystem mode, n8n only prunes binary data in the filesystem. This may change in future. Valid values are 'default' | 'filesystem' | 's3'. For more information, see https://docs.n8n.io/hosting/configuration/environment-variables/binary-data/
mode.title: mode

localStoragePath.description: Path for binary data storage in 'filesystem' mode. If not set, the default path will be used. For more information, see https://docs.n8n.io/hosting/configuration/environment-variables/binary-data/
localStoragePath.title: localStoragePath

s3.description: S3-compatible external storage configurations. For more information, see https://docs.n8n.io/hosting/configuration/environment-variables/external-data-storage/

host.description: Host of the n8n bucket in S3-compatible external storage. For example, s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com
host.title: host

bucketName.description: Name of the n8n bucket in S3-compatible external storage.
bucketName.title: bucketName

bucketRegion.description: Region of the S3-compatible external storage bucket. For example, us-east-1
bucketRegion.title: bucketRegion

accessKey.description: Access key in S3-compatible external storage
accessKey.title: accessKey

accessSecret.description: Access secret in S3-compatible external storage
accessSecret.title: accessSecret

existingSecret.description: This is for setting up the s3 file storage existing secret. Must contain access-key-id and secret-access-key keys.
existingSecret.title: existingSecret

s3.title: s3

maxQueryExecutionTime.description: Only queries that exceed this time (ms) will be logged. Set `0` to disable.
maxQueryExecutionTime.title: maxQueryExecutionTime

options.description: Database logging level. Requires `maxQueryExecutionTime` to be higher than `0`. Valid values 'query' | 'error' | 'schema' | 'warn' | 'info' | 'log' | 'all'
options.title: options

poolSize.description: SQLite database pool size. Set to `0` to disable pooling.
poolSize.title: poolSize

vacuum.description: Runs VACUUM operation on startup to rebuild the database. Reduces file size and optimizes indexes. This is a long running blocking operation and increases start-up time.
vacuum.title: vacuum

tablePrefix.description: Prefix to use for table names.
tablePrefix.title: tablePrefix

type.description: Type of database to use. Valid values 'sqlite' | 'postgresdb'
type.title: type

defaultLocale.description: A locale identifier, compatible with the Accept-Language header. n8n doesn't support regional identifiers, such as de-AT.
defaultLocale.title: defaultLocale

externalTaskRunnersDsn.description: Sentry DSN for external task runners.
externalTaskRunnersDsn.title: externalTaskRunnersDsn

encryptionKey.description: If you install n8n first time, you can keep this empty and it will be auto generated and never change again. If you already have a encryption key generated before, please use it here.
encryptionKey.title: encryptionKey

existingEncryptionKeySecret.description: The name of an existing secret with encryption key. The secret must contain a key with the name N8N_ENCRYPTION_KEY.
existingEncryptionKeySecret.title: existingEncryptionKeySecret

database.description: The name of the external PostgreSQL database. For more information: https://docs.n8n.io/hosting/configuration/supported-databases-settings/#required-permissions
database.title: database

existingSecret.description:
The name of an existing secret with PostgreSQL (must contain key `postgres-password`) and credentials.
When it's set, the `externalPostgresql.password` parameter is ignored
existingSecret.title: existingSecret

existingSecret.description:
The name of an existing secret with Redis (must contain key `redis-password`) and Sentinel credentials.
When it's set, the `externalRedis.password` parameter is ignored
existingSecret.title: existingSecret

extraEnvVars.description: DEPRECATED: Use main, worker, and webhook blocks extraEnvVars fields instead. This field will be removed in a future release.
extraEnvVars.title: extraEnvVars

extraSecretNamesForEnvFrom.description: DEPRECATED: Use main, worker, and webhook blocks extraSecretNamesForEnvFrom fields instead. This field will be removed in a future release.
extraSecretNamesForEnvFrom.title: extraSecretNamesForEnvFrom

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global

image.description: This sets the container image more information can be found here: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images/

pullPolicy.description: This sets the pull policy for images.
pullPolicy.title: pullPolicy

tag.description: Overrides the image tag whose default is the chart appVersion.
tag.title: tag

image.title: image

imagePullSecrets.description: This is for the secretes for pulling an image from a private repository more information can be found here: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/pull-image-private-registry/
imagePullSecrets.title: imagePullSecrets

ingress.description: This block is for setting up the ingress for more information can be found here: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/ingress/
ingress.title: ingress

livenessProbe.description: DEPRECATED: Use main, worker, and webhook blocks livenessProbe field instead. This field will be removed in a future release.
livenessProbe.title: livenessProbe

location.description: Location of the log files inside `~/.n8n`. Only for `file` log output.
location.title: location

maxcount.description: Max number of log files to keep, or max number of days to keep logs for. Once the limit is reached, the oldest log files will be rotated out. If using days, append a `d` suffix. Only for `file` log output.
maxcount.title: maxcount

maxsize.description: The maximum size (in MB) for each log file. By default, n8n uses 16 MB.
maxsize.title: maxsize

level.description: The log output level. The available options are (from lowest to highest level) are error, warn, info, and debug. The default value is info. You can learn more about these options [here](https://docs.n8n.io/hosting/logging-monitoring/logging/#log-levels).
level.title: level

output.description: Where to output logs to. Options are: `console` or `file` or both.
output.title: output

scopes.description: Scopes to filter logs by. Nothing is filtered by default. Supported log scopes: concurrency, external-secrets, license, multi-main-setup, pubsub, redis, scaling, waiting-executions
scopes.title: scopes

nodes.description: Node configurations for built-in and external npm packages

builtin.description: Enable built-in node functions (e.g., HTTP Request, Code Node, etc.)

enabled.description: Enable built-in modules for the Code node
enabled.title: enabled

modules.description: List of built-in Node.js modules to allow in the Code node (e.g., crypto, fs). Use '*' to allow all.
modules.title: modules

external.description: External npm packages to install and allow in the Code node

reinstallMissingPackages.description: Whether to reinstall missing packages. For more information, see https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/community-nodes/troubleshooting/#error-missing-packages
reinstallMissingPackages.title: reinstallMissingPackages

packages.description: List of npm package names and versions (e.g., "package-name@1.0.0")
packages.title: packages

external.title: external

image.description: Image for the init container to install npm packages

repository.description: Repository for the init container to install npm packages
repository.title: repository

tag.description: Tag for the init container to install npm packages
tag.title: tag

pullPolicy.description: Pull policy for the init container to install npm packages
pullPolicy.title: pullPolicy

limits.description: This block is for setting up the resource management for the init container more information can be found here: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/

cpu.description: CPU for the init container to install npm packages
cpu.title: cpu

memory.description: Memory for the init container to install npm packages

memory.title: memory

url.description: URL of the private npm registry (e.g., https://registry.npmjs.org/)

secretName.description: Name of the Kubernetes secret containing npm registry credentials

secretKey.title: secretKey
secretKey.description: Key in the secret for the .npmrc content or auth token

customNpmrc.title: customNpmrc
customNpmrc.description: Custom .npmrc content (optional, overrides secret if provided)

activationKey.description: Activation key to initialize license. Not applicable if the n8n instance was already activated. For more information please refer to the following link: https://docs.n8n.io/enterprise-key/
activationKey.title: activationKey

existingActivationKeySecret.description: The name of an existing secret with license activation key. The secret must contain a key with the name N8N_LICENSE_ACTIVATION_KEY.
existingActivationKeySecret.title: existingActivationKeySecret

enabled.description: Enables (true) or disables (false) autorenewal for licenses. If disabled, you need to manually renew the license every 10 days by navigating to Settings > Usage and plan, and pressing F5. Failure to renew the license will disable Enterprise features.
enabled.title: enabled

offsetInHours.description: The offset in hours before expiry a license should automatically renew. The default value is 72 hours (3 days).
offsetInHours.title: offsetInHours

serverUrl.description: Server URL to retrieve license. The default value is https://license.n8n.io/v1.
serverUrl.title: serverUrl

tenantId.description: Tenant ID associated with the license. Only set this variable if explicitly instructed by n8n.
tenantId.title: tenantId

count.description: Number of main nodes. Only enterprise license users can have one leader main node and mutiple follower main nodes.
count.title: count

pdb.description: PodDisruptionBudget configuration for the main node

enabled.description: Whether to enable the PodDisruptionBudget for the main node
enabled.title: enabled

minAvailable.description: Minimum number of available replicas for the main node
minAvailable.title: minAvailable

maxUnavailable.description: Maximum number of unavailable replicas for the main node
maxUnavailable.title: maxUnavailable

address.description: This sets the address for the broker of the external task runner
address.title: address

port.description: This sets the port for the broker of the external task runner
port.title: port

mainNodeAuthToken.description: This sets the auth token for the n8n main node of the external task runner
mainNodeAuthToken.title: mainNodeAuthToken

workerNodeAuthToken.description: This sets the auth token for the n8n worker node of the external task runner
workerNodeAuthToken.title: workerNodeAuthToken

autoShutdownTimeout.description: This sets the auto shutdown timeout for the external task runner in seconds
autoShutdownTimeout.title: autoShutdownTimeout

port.description: This sets the ports for the external task runner more information can be found here: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#field-spec-ports
port.title: port

nodeOptions.description: This sets the node options for the external task runner
nodeOptions.title: nodeOptions

enabled.description: Whether to save workflow history versions
enabled.title: enabled

pruneTime.description: Time (in hours) to keep workflow history versions for. To disable it, use -1 as a value
pruneTime.title: pruneTime

serviceMonitor.description: The ServiceMonitor configuration for the n8n deployment. Please refer to the following link for more information: https://github.com/prometheus-operator/prometheus-operator/blob/main/Documentation/api-reference/api.md

enabled.description: Whether to enable the ServiceMonitor for the n8n deployment
enabled.title: enabled

namespace.description: The namespace for the ServiceMonitor. If empty, the ServiceMonitor will be deployed in the same namespace as the n8n chart.
namespace.title: namespace

labels.description: The labels for the ServiceMonitor, use this to define your scrape label for Prometheus Operator
labels.title: labels

targetLabels.description: Set of labels to transfer from the Kubernetes Service onto the target
targetLabels.title: targetLabels

metricRelabelings.description: The metric relabelings for the ServiceMonitor, following Prometheus relabel_config structure
metricRelabelings.title: metricRelabelings

sourceLabels.description: The source labels to relabel from

regex.description: The regular expression to match against source labels

targetLabel.description: The label to write the result to

separator.description: Separator used when concatenating source labels

modulus.description: Modulus to use with hashmod action

metricsPrefix.description: The metrics prefix for the ServiceMonitor
metricsPrefix.title: metricsPrefix

include.description: Metrics and labels to include in the ServiceMonitor
include.title: include

messageEventBusMetrics.description: Whether to include message event bus metrics
messageEventBusMetrics.title: messageEventBusMetrics

workflowIdLabel.description: Whether to include workflow id label
workflowIdLabel.title: workflowIdLabel

nodeTypeLabel.description: Whether to include node type label
nodeTypeLabel.title: nodeTypeLabel

credentialTypeLabel.description: Whether to include credential type label
credentialTypeLabel.title: credentialTypeLabel

apiPathLabel.description: Whether to include api path label
apiPathLabel.title: apiPathLabel

apiMethodLabel.description: Whether to include api method label
apiMethodLabel.title: apiMethodLabel

apiStatusCodeLabel.description: Whether to include api status code label
apiStatusCodeLabel.title: apiStatusCodeLabel

serviceMonitor.title: serviceMonitor

name.description: This is for setting up the bucket name.
name.title: name

policy.description: This is for setting up the bucket policy.
policy.title: policy

purge.description: This is for setting up the purge.
purge.title: purge

versioning.description: This is for setting up the versioning.
versioning.title: versioning

drivesPerNode.description: Number of drives attached to a node
drivesPerNode.title: drivesPerNode

ingress.description: Minio ingress. n8n will use this ingress to access Minio. It's required when fileStorage.mode is s3.
ingress.title: ingress

name.description: This is for setting up the policy name.
name.title: name

rootPassword.description: Minio root password. Length should be at least 8 characters.
rootPassword.title: rootPassword

rootUser.description: Minio root user. Length should be at least 3 characters.
rootUser.title: rootUser

items.description: A list of IPv4 or IPv6 addresses to use as DNS nameservers.

nameservers.description: List of DNS nameserver IP addresses (IPv4 or IPv6).

searches.description: List of DNS search domains for hostname lookup.
